page.title: 08Ecology
page.content: There is a large area of common-land, which is especially interesting because parts of it are very wet and boggy.Many fungi grow there,and in the autumn of 1984,120 different species were recorded.There is a lot of woodland and scrubland,but few areas of bracken. The usual small mammals are to be found,but of outstanding interest is the Muntjac deer,small herds inhabiting the common.It is about the size of a small dog, and its cry is similar to the bark of a dog.It is a shy creature and not often seen. There are many footpaths all over the area,which are quite well used by local people.Beside the river Ver is a footpath leading right to St.Albans and beyond.
